air.hintt: A friendly combination of oyxgen and other elements that helps one avoid death.

base/earth.title: Earth Backdrop
base/earth.hintt: A rare handheld chunk of earth backdrop, sometimes referred to as "Bruce".

base/maw.hintt: A crevice in the earth that spews terrapi and other small mobs. Maws can be temporarily blocked by solid blocks, whereas a @plug will permanently close them and advance the player's Pest Control achievements.

base/maw-plugged.title: Plugged Maw
base/maw-plugged.hintt: A plugged maw, no longer capable of spewing mobs.

base/pipe.hintt: An old pipeline that spews automata and other, more dangerous mobs. Much like maws, culverts can be plugged permanently with a @plug or covered temporarily with a solid block.
base/pipe.title: Culvert

base/pipe-plugged.title: Plugged Culvert
base/pipe-plugged.hintt: A plugged culvert, no longer capable of spewing mobs.

base/water.title: Ocean
base/water.hintt: The endless blue sea, offering solace, tranquility, and that crushing feeling of millions of tons of water pushing you into the depths.

base/drawing-modern.title: Modern Graffiti
base/drawing-modern.hintt: Modern graffiti, drawn by survivors of the apocalypse or the recently deceased.

base/drawing-historical.title: Historical Graffiti
base/drawing-historical.hintt: Ancient graffiti, artistic representations of a bygone era or some other unknown origin.

base/drawing-danger.title: Warning Graffiti
base/drawing-danger.hintt: Warnings drawn by the survivors of the apocalpyse. Generally, the artist is no longer surviving.

liquid/water.hintt: The giver and taker of life. Water and other liquids can be transported via Butler bots, or more rarely, in solidified block form. Water does no damage but does lead to drowning if submerged past one's survival skill.

liquid/acid.hintt: A common and tragic byproduct of the bygone industrial age and apocalypse. Acid falls from the sky and soaks the earth of most biomes, causing damage on touch. Acid can be transported with a butler bot and jarred for use in scientific experimentation.

liquid/magma.hintt: Once difficult to find, magma now bubbles up into even the most temperate regions due to rifts caused by the apocalpyse. Onyx butler bots can transport it, but be careful - it's hot!

back/stone.title: Stone Backdrop
back/stone.hintt: Common stone backing, frequently found decayed and crumbling both above and belowground.

back/iron.title: Iron Backdrop
back/iron.hintt: Solid iron backing, useful for large-scale industrial projects and slightly hardier than brass and copper.

back/copper.title: Copper Backdrop
back/copper.hintt: Solid copper backing, often used to contain acid pools in abandoned industrial warehouses.

back/brass.title: Brass Backdrop
back/brass.hintt: Solid brass backing, offering both toughness and a splash of color for all your metallic needs.

back/earth-brick.title: Earth Brick Backdrop
back/earth-brick.hintt: For the absolute budget builder, you can't beat the affordability of earth bricks. Just dig and build and dig and build and repeat!

back/adobe.title: Adobe Backdrop
back/adobe.hintt: Adobe backing is very simple to construct, requiring mostly just earth. You may look like a cheapskate, but at least your house will be huge.

back/cork.hintt: Cork is known mostly for its tremendous ability to keep wine tasty, but it also serves as a nice decorative backdrop for butterflies and other such curiosities.

back/bloodstone.title: Bloodstone Backdrop
back/bloodstone.hintt: Bloodstone backing provides dark and mysterious overtones to building projects. Bloodstone itself is only found in Hell worlds.

back/marble.title: Marble Backdrop
back/marble.hintt: Marble backing makes any structure look fancy. Goes great with columns, statues, and Greek gods.

back/sandstone.title: Sandstone Brick Backdrop
back/sandstone.hintt: A simple backdrop to complement your sandstone constructions.

back/limestone.title: Limestone Brick Backdrop
back/limestone.hintt: A simple backdrop to complement your limestone constructions.

back/cobblestone-gray.title: Gray Cobblestone Backdrop
back/cobblestone-gray.hintt: A detailed backdrop to complement stone or gray cobblestone buildings.

back/cobblestone-tan.title: Tan Cobblestone Backdrop
back/cobblestone-tan.hintt: A detailed backdrop to complement sandstone or tan cobblestone buildings.

back/brick.title: Brick Backdrop
back/brick.hintt: Classic red brick backing makes for an excellent home or firehouse.

back/brick-mixed.title: Mixed Brick Backdrop
back/brick-mixed.hintt: Mixed brick backing gives you that classic redbrick feel plus 15% extra spiffyness.

back/brick-tan.title: Tan Brick Backdrop
back/brick-tan.hintt: Tan brick backing goes great with Deepworld's many earth tones. Including earth itself!

back/brick-blue.title: Blue Brick Backdrop
back/brick-blue.hintt: Everyone expects a RED brick. Blow their hats off with this blueish alternative!

back/wood.title: Wood Backdrop
back/wood.hintt: Standard wood backing is a mainstay in old houses and warehouses, where it often molds and serves as fodder for scrap wood collection.

back/wood-panel.title: Wood Panel
back/wood-panel.hintt: Wood panelling is a basic construction backing, ideal for most civilized building projects.

back/wood-panel-decorative.title: Fancy Wood Panel
back/wood-panel-decorative.hintt: When panelling just doesn't look nice enough, try this fancy panelling to add a little extra pizazz.

back/paper.hintt: Plain paper is mostly used as an ingredient for fancier wallpapers, but it's good for simple decorating in a pinch.

back/wallpaper-1.title: Gold Damask Wallpaper
back/wallpaper-1.hintt: Damask patterns are the king of Victorian wallpapers, and golden damask is surely the shiniest way to show them off.

back/wallpaper-2.title: Faded Floral Wallpaper
back/wallpaper-2.hintt: This worn-in wallpaper gives a great abandoned-yet-once-stylish feel for all your bunker needs.

back/wallpaper-3.title: Art Deco Wallpaper
back/wallpaper-3.hintt: Art Deco stylings are key for the forward-thinking home decorator.

back/wallpaper-4.title: Blue Quatrefoil Wallpaper
back/wallpaper-4.hintt: Everybody loves shapes! Put some on your wall with this fine wallpaper.

back/wallpaper-5.title: Chartreuse Damask Wallpaper
back/wallpaper-5.hintt: Make a bold statement with this bright twist on the damask classic. Goes great with an acid swimming pool!

back/wallpaper-7.title: Blue Crab Wallpaper
back/wallpaper-7.hintt: Showcase your nautical sensibilities with this lovely crab-themed wallpaper. Hey, who's hungry for some crab legs!

ground/earth.hintt: Earth is the most common item in Deepworld. It's very useful for supporting buildings or quickly walling off approaching brains, but don't expect it to last very long if you just leave it in the sky.

ground/dug.hintt: Shovelling and earthquakes leave behind dug earth, which isn't terribly useful but does allow easy passage.

ground/earth-dug.hintt: Shovelling and earthquakes leave behind dug earth, which isn't terribly useful but does allow easy passage.

ground/earth-disintegrating.hintt: Shovelling and earthquakes leave behind dug earth, which isn't terribly useful but does allow easy passage.
ground/earth-disintegrating.title: Disintegrating Earth

ground/sandstone.title: Sandstone
ground/sandstone.hintt: Raw sandstone is found in plain and desert worlds, and is useful mainly for creating sandstone brick and backdrop.

ground/limestone.title: Limestone
ground/limestone.hintt: Raw limestone is found in plain and arctic worlds, and is useful mainly for creating limestone brick and backdrop.

ground/bone-wall.hintt: Human remains can be icky, but squish 'em together into a block and you have the perfect accessory for a crypt, mausoleum, or loan shark operation!

ground/sand.hintt: Sand is found in desert worlds and offers the welcoming memory of sunning on the beach, except with more apocalypse.

ground/stone.hintt: Raw stone is used to construct both building blocks as well as a wide variety of furniture and other items.

ground/flax.hintt: Flax is a malleable substance used to make rope, balloons, lighting, and all kinds of miscellaneous items. It can be harvested quite easily from many plants.

ground/earth-compost.title: Compost
ground/earth-compost.hintt: Compost grows plants when placed in rainy purified areas. It can be generated by visiting a composter, a large machine found underground in many worlds.

ground/resin.hintt: Sticky resin is an exceptionally useful material used to create many kinds of items. Roots, vines, and terrapus eggs are all a good source for it (just remember to wash your hands after scraping it off).

ground/copper-ore.hintt: Raw copper is commonly combined with zinc to create brass, a metal with many construction uses.

ground/zinc-ore.hintt: Raw zinc is commonly combined with copper to create brass, a metal with many construction uses.

ground/iron-ore.hintt: Raw iron ore can be used to make iron blocks and backdrops.

ground/quartz-ore.hintt: Quartz has interesting electric properties which make it ideal for the construction of machines like clocks, switches, and other things that make you shout "SCIENCE!"

ground/sulfur-ore.hintt: Sulfur may be stinky, but it's necessary to create gunpowder. Which is useful for blowing up people who call you stinky.

ground/onyx.hintt: Onyx is the rarest mineral in Deepworld. It is used to craft many of the most powerful variants of tools, accessories, and machines. There is usually one or two found in each world.

ground/blackrock.hint: Blackrock is the toughest known natural stone. It is unmineable and can only be cleared with the use of bombs.

building/earth-brick.title: Earth Brick
building/earth-brick.hintt: For the absolute budget builder, you can't beat the affordability of earth bricks. Just dig and build and dig and build and repeat!

signs/plaque.hint: Plaques are signs that designate a landmark, which allows them to appear on the world map.

signs/plaque-landmark.hint: Landmark Plaques are signs that designate a world landmark and can be voted on.
signs/plaque-landmark.title: Landmark Plaque

rubble/skeleton.hint: Human remains can be buried on the surface to obtain Undertaker achievements. Dig a 2x1 hole on the surface, place a skeleton in it, and place a gravestone directly above it on the left side. If the grave fills itself, you know you've done it right!

sections.text: You can find more hair options in unopened chests.

containers/cage-pet.title: Pet Cage
containers/cage-pet.hintt: This extra durable cage allows the domestication of bunnies, crows, vultures, skunks, and terrapi. Just surround with dirt and then trap em!

containers/pet-terrapus.title: Pet Terrapus
containers/pet-terrapus.hintt: This cage spawns a pet terrapus when mined.

containers/pet-crow.title: Pet Crow
containers/pet-crow.hintt: This cage spawns a pet crow when mined.

containers/pet-bunny.title: Pet Bunny
containers/pet-bunny.hintt: This cage spawns a pet bunny when mined.

containers/pet-skunk.title: Pet Skunk
containers/pet-skunk.hintt: This cage spawns a pet skunk when mined.

containers/pet-vulture.title: Pet Vulture
containers/pet-vulture.hintt: This cage spawns a pet vulture when mined.

mechanical/relay.hint: Relays let you add randomness and delays to switchable items. Place a switch and then a relay to try it out!

mechanical/geck-tub.title: Purifier
mechanical/geck-tub.hint: The purifier has seven parts scattered throughout the world which need to be collected in order to begin functioning. Once all of these are found, the base must be activated by a player, at which point the world will gradually lose acidity and eventually support new plant life!

mechanical/composter-chamber.title: Composter
mechanical/composter-chamber.hint: The composter has five parts scattered throughout the world which need to be collected in order to begin functioning. Once all are found, players can click the active composter to exchange earth and guano for composted earth. If the world has been purified, these blocks can be placed to support plant growth.

mechanical/recycler-chamber.title: Recycler
mechanical/recycler-chamber.hint: The recycler has five parts scattered throughout the world which need to be collected in order to begin functioning. Once all are found, you can click the active recycler to generate building metals from scrap metal.

hell/expiator-face.title: Expiator
hell/expiator-face.hint: The expiator has seven parts scattered throughout the world which need to be collected in order to begin functioning. Once all are found, players can lead ghosts to the machine to deliver them out of Hell.

hell/dish.title: Infernal Protector
hell/dish.hint: Infernal protectors cause damage as well as protecting blocks, and can only be disabled by delivering enough souls with the expiator.

mechanical/teleporter.hint: Click on teleporters to quickly travel throughout the world. Inactive teleporters can be repaired with a click, progressing you towards a Teleporter Repairman achievement and unlocking the teleporter for use by players.

mechanical/teleporter-mini.title: Target Teleporter
mechanical/teleporter-mini.hint: Target teleporters allow teleportation to a specific location nearby. Place a beacon after placing the teleporter to identify the location. As your engineering skill increases, you can place it farther and farther away!

tools/pickaxe.hintt: This handy tool allows mining of most items in the game. It is useless in protected areas, though, so break out a shovel if you find yourself unable to mine.

tools/sledgehammer.hintt: Sledges offer excellent melee damage and the highest chance for critical hits. Their bludgeoning damage type is especially useful against automata.

tools/shovel.hintt: The shovel allows fast digging of earth and digging through protected areas. This is especially useful for making your way to the entrance of underground dungeons, which are usually protected by brain devices.

tools/net.hintt: A weak melee tool, the net can be used to catch butterflies and insects and effectively turn them into pleasant wall decorations.

tools/spade.hintt: The spade is a slow mining tool that allows you to occasionally recoup bulbs when mining grown flowers. Use better spades and increase your Horticulture skill to improve your chances of recouping!

tools/pistol.title: Pistol
tools/pistol.hintt: The simplest ranged weapon, a pistol is nevertheless effective at killing small mobs. Click and hold down the mouse button OR spacebar to shoot.

shields/force.title: Force Shield
shields/force.tooltip: Guard against projectiles.|Activate with 'x' or RMB.

shields/acid.title: Acid Shield
shields/acid.tooltip: Guard against acid rain and projectiles.|Activate with 'x' or RMB.

accessories/makeup.hintt: Adds additional skin and hair colors.
accessories/makeup.title: Makeup Kit

accessories/exo-skin.hintt: Grants immunity to acid and magma.

accessories/dowsing-rod.hintt: Doubles chances of finding rich veins.
